subject: AI & Agents
title: Contamination: When the Test Is in the Training Data
description: A quick, practical guide to Contamination: When the Test Is in the Training Data.

hook.text: The model aces the benchmark. Then you realize the benchmark questions were in its training set.

buildup.text: Data contamination occurs when test data leaks into the training set, inflating scores.

discovery.text: Web-scale training data inevitably includes published benchmarks, papers, and answer keys.

twist.text: A contaminated model memorizes answers instead of learning skills. It fails on novel variants.

climax.text: Mitigation: use held-out benchmarks, canary strings, and novel rephrased test sets.

punchline.text: A test you've seen isn't a test. It's a memory quiz.

quiz.question: What is benchmark contamination?
options: Test data appearing in the model's training set
